text: The Paradise Bangkok Molam International Band is a hybridized roots music band from Thailand. Their musical style is a mixture of traditional Thai music. There are also elements of blues, folk rock and some dub of folk-rock, blues and dub.The Guardian, Friday 5 December 2014 - The Paradise Bangkok Molam International Band: 21st Century Molam review – a rousing debut - Robin Denselow They have appeared at various international concerts. ==Background== The formation of the band came about as a result of a DJ project in a bid to bring back to life Thai sounds deemed lost.JamBase, Oct 26, 2016 - Around The World In A Neddy Daze Edition: Paradise Bangkok Molam International Band, Xylouris White, Noura Mint Seymali & More by Aaron Stein While an unknown act in their country, they released their debut album 21st Century Molam. Their second album was Planet Lam.Bangkok Post, 1 Jan 2017 - When Grassroots Sounds Go Global - CHANUN POOMSAWAI The album was released on 21 October 2016. It has been said that the inspiration for the album came from a club owned by label co-owner Maft Sai. It had the same name.The Attic, 25 October 2016 - Bandcamp pick of the week: The Paradise Bangkok Molam International Band - Planet Lam ==Live performances== They have appeared in Bucharest in an event organized by online music magazine, The Attic.The Guardian, Friday 5 December 2014 - The Paradise Bangkok Molam International Band: 21st Century Molam review – a rousing debut - Robin Denselow The other various festivals they have appeared at include the Off Festival in Poland, Festival Mundial in The Netherlands, The Glastonbury and Field Day festivals in the UK.Bangkok Post, 1 Jan 2017 - When Grassroots Sounds Go Global - CHANUN POOMSAWAI While at the Field Day fest, they came on at 4.40pm, Saturday June 11, appearing on the Moth Club stage.Time Out, Monday June 6 2016 - Your ultimate guide to Field Day 2016 (plus the full stage times) by James Manning ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+ Singles |- !
